014package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
015
016import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
017
018import java.io.IOException;
019import java.io.InputStream;
020import java.sql.ResultSet;
021import java.sql.SQLException;
022import java.util.Collections;
023import java.util.Iterator;
024import java.util.Map;
025import java.util.Properties;
026import java.util.logging.Logger;
027
028import org.postgresql.pljava.ResultSetProvider;
029
030/**
031 * An example that retrieves a {@code Properties} resource, and returns
032 * (key,value) rows from it by implementing the {@code ResultSetProvider}
033 * interface.
034 * @author Thomas Hallgren
035 */
036public class UsingProperties implements ResultSetProvider.Large
037{
038    private static Logger s_logger = Logger.getAnonymousLogger();
039    private final Iterator m_propertyIterator;
040    
041    public UsingProperties()
042    throws IOException
043    {
044        Properties v = new Properties();
045        InputStream propStream = this.getClass().getResourceAsStream("example.properties");
046        if(propStream == null)
047        {
048            s_logger.fine("example.properties was null");
049            m_propertyIterator = Collections.EMPTY_SET.iterator();
050        }
051        else
052        {
053            v.load(propStream);
054            propStream.close();
055            s_logger.fine("example.properties has " + v.size() + " entries");
056            m_propertyIterator = v.entrySet().iterator();
057        }
058    }
059
060    public boolean assignRowValues(ResultSet receiver, long currentRow)
061            throws SQLException
062    {
063        if(!m_propertyIterator.hasNext())
064        {
065            s_logger.fine("no more rows, returning false");
066            return false;
067        }
068        Map.Entry propEntry = (Map.Entry)m_propertyIterator.next();
069        receiver.updateString(1, (String)propEntry.getKey());
070        receiver.updateString(2, (String)propEntry.getValue());
071        // s_logger.fine("next row created, returning true");
072        return true;
073    }
074
075    /**
076     * Return the contents of the {@code example.properties} resource,
077     * one (key,value) row per entry.
078     */
079    @Function( type = "javatest._properties")
080    public static ResultSetProvider propertyExampleAnno()
081    throws SQLException
082    {
083        try
084        {
085            return new UsingProperties();
086        }
087        catch(IOException e)
088        {
089            throw new SQLException("Error reading properties", e.getMessage());
090        }
091    }
092
093    public void close()
094    {
095    }
096}
